page.title: 12MEDIA IN DUMFRIES
page.content: {DUMFRIES & GALLOWAY STANDARD The Standard has been in business since 1849.Nearly 32,000 copies are produced each week,20,000 each Friday and nearly 12,000 each Wednesday and there are aproximately 3.5 readers per paper.Between 50 & 60 people are employed by the Standard,but only 11 are employed full time.Work starts for the Friday edition of the Standard a week before and for the Wednesday edition the work starts on the Thursday of the week before.The information supplied to the Standard comes from the council,the public and from people just walking into the office.The price of the Standard is 20p.
